review_title: This was not a good experience
job_title: Executive Assistant to the President in Bowie, MD
pros: This was not a good experience, so no pros to speak of.
cons: Salary way too low for the amount of work and hours required. Workload super heavy for one person. One will get off work just to go home and work some more. Expected one to already know BSU's processes with very little training. Cannot utilize the tutorials to learn because workload is so heavy for one person. Not a positive place to work. At least not administratively. Under-minded by other staff. They say they will help you, but willing to throw one under the bus. Was told in the interview that the President works 365 days a year, but I did not have to. That is not true. She really wants someone to be there all hours of the day, night, and weekends. She should have just said that so she could have found to right person. Trying to sugar coat the position creates falsehoods. The job is a teardown to one’s self-esteem. Got a phone call before I could even get out of the building saying it is not me. I was like number 6 or 7. Therefore, high turnover. Since the President has only been at BSU for 4 years herself, she is averaging two assistants a year either by not a "good fit" or the assistant left on their own. In my interview with another Director to see if HR could find me something else, I was told the President is out of touch with the processes. She expected a quick turn around when the process does not allow for a quick turnaround. The President has a public email that has over 11K emails. She would not let me clean it up so the emails she needed could be found quick and easy. Then I was penalized for not seeing everything that was needed. After leaving, so much negative information came my way about the Office of the President, that I wished I had known beforehand so I could have just tuned down the position. It was not worth the headache. Glad this short chapter is over.

review_title: CDL/Motor Coach Operator- I've been working here 2 and a half years, working in an office with an associate Bus Operator
job_title: CDL/Motor Coach Operator in Bowie, MD
pros: Doing the best that I can with what I know from previous Employer's like Dillon's Bus Service and Keller's Bus Service. At Dillon's, I was making at least 70,000.00 a year. Here, at BSU as a Driver/ Office worker, I'm slowly get a few raises, not based on work performance, but from Union People helping to raise members paychecks. Not looking to get a promotion in the near future.
cons: There are an abundant amount of time off when there are holidays and vacation days available. Can't compete with fellow employees who have been here longer.

pros: As a USM employee, you get tuition remission, but do not expect free school.  The campus is located in a great area with its own MARC train stop. It also appears to be very difficult to be terminated. You have all the benefits of being a state employee.
cons: The pay is among the lowest for universities in the state of Maryland. The fees and fines on some items that are already employee benefits for working at the University are crazy when you try to attend classes at BSU. Health benefits are expensive.  The turn-over is ridiculous. Employees are constantly leaving and they are very slow to replace them. This leaves those who remain with more work than can be managed.

pros: Good working environment.  Great school for teaching. Nice facilities. Deans are fairly progressive.  University is making improvements in several critical areas - academic support, technology, facilities.  Potential additional resources looming from lawsuit against state of Maryland
cons: Moderate pay.  Not a heavy research institution.  Based on entrance requirements students are not as prepared as needed to perform rigors of many academic areas.  Could use more resources for faculty for support - lap tops, internal IT infrastructure.  A recent growth in upper level Administrators.  Increased demands on instructors without sufficient increase in instructor resources.

review_title: Bowie State University, Bowie, Maryland needs to enter this century.
pros: Students may feel that resources are more accessible due to relatively small campus. Administration is overtly biased to promoting staff persons who are school alums. Very prejudiced and small minded.
cons: Staff is coagulated and static. Same persons have been there for years. Many of the staff are related or members of the alumni. Not inclusive, nor particularly helpful for students who need the broad exposure that only comes from hiring persons who have diverse backgrounds.

review_title: Bowie State is the Worst Place to Work in Higher Education - They Have No Respect for Faculty
pros: The students are what keeps the faculty there dealing with the inept administration.
cons: The Administration - I been working here for almost ten years and no one is really happy. The President and his staff are horrible. I get high performance appraisals so this is not sour grapes.

pros: It is a great experience to work at bowie state university because of the great team work, building a dynamic future and maintaining a good standard of education in the university of maryland system.
cons: bowie state university is one of the oldest HBCU in the country, its sad that the university don't get enough support from the government, alumni and multi-national companies.
